intro: Erigeron seravschanicus, commonly known as the Karakoram fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron seravschanicus plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
